results.title: Effects of simvastatin and metformin on polycystic ovary syndrome after six months of treatment.
results.text_hl: Total @CHEMICAL_Testosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013739 @@@testosterone@@@ decreased significantly and comparably in all groups: by 25.6, 25.6, and 20.1% in the S, M, and SM groups, respectively. Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ improved menstrual cyclicity and decreased @<m>DISEASE_Hirsutism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006628 @@@hirsutism@@@, @DISEASE_Acne_Vulgaris @DISEASE_MESH:D000152 @@@acne@@@, ovarian volume, body mass index, @GENE_CRP @GENE_1401 @@@C-reactive protein@@@, and soluble @GENE_VCAM1 @GENE_7412 @@@vascular cell adhesion molecule-1@@@.

citations.NLM: Banaszewska B, Pawelczyk L, Spaczynski RZ, Duleba AJ. Effects of simvastatin and metformin on polycystic ovary syndrome after six months of treatment. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 2011 Nov;96(11):3493-501. PMID: 21865358
citations.BibTeX: @article{21865358, title={Effects of simvastatin and metformin on polycystic ovary syndrome after six months of treatment.}, author={Banaszewska B and Pawelczyk L and Spaczynski RZ and Duleba AJ}, journal={J Clin Endocrinol Metab}, volume={96}, number={11}, pages={3493-501}}

results.title: Long-term effects of combined simvastatin and metformin treatment on the clinical abnormalities and ovulation dysfunction in single young women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: Improved menstrual regularity and decreased @<m>DISEASE_Hirsutism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006628 @@@hirsutism@@@, @DISEASE_Acne_Vulgaris @DISEASE_MESH:D000152 @@@acne@@@, ovarian volume, and BMI had been significantly noticed in the study groups A and C, although still relatively higher in group C.

citations.NLM: Seyam E, Hefzy E. Long-term effects of combined simvastatin and metformin treatment on the clinical abnormalities and ovulation dysfunction in single young women with polycystic ovary syndrome. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2018 Dec;34(12):1073-1080. PMID: 30044162
citations.BibTeX: @article{30044162, title={Long-term effects of combined simvastatin and metformin treatment on the clinical abnormalities and ovulation dysfunction in single young women with polycystic ovary syndrome.}, author={Seyam E and Hefzy E}, journal={Gynecol Endocrinol}, volume={34}, number={12}, pages={1073-1080}}

results.title: Comparison of Metformin and Simvastatin Administration in Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Before Intra-Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection Cycle: A Prospective, Randomized, Clinical Trial Study
results.text_hl: ...Both drugs improved @<m>DISEASE_Hirsutism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006628 @@@hirsutism@@@ score significantly, but @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ better than @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (Group A, 24.5 +- 3.6 P: 0.0001 VS Group B, 22.9 +- 5.9 P: 0.003).

citations.NLM: Pourmatroud E, Mohammadjafari R, Roozitalab M. Comparison of Metformin and Simvastatin Administration in Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Before Intra-Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection Cycle: A Prospective, Randomized, Clinical Trial Study Iran Red Crescent Med J. 2015 Dec;17(12):e20082. PMID: 26756007
citations.BibTeX: @article{26756007, title={Comparison of Metformin and Simvastatin Administration in Women With Polycystic Ovary Syndrome Before Intra-Cytoplasmic Sperm Injection Cycle: A Prospective, Randomized, Clinical Trial Study}, author={Pourmatroud E and Mohammadjafari R and Roozitalab M}, journal={Iran Red Crescent Med J}, volume={17}, number={12}, pages={e20082}}

results.title: Evaluation of prolonged use of statins on the clinical and biochemical abnormalities and ovulation dysfunction in single young women with polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: Improved menstrual regularity and decreased @<m>DISEASE_Hirsutism</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006628 @@@hirsutism@@@, @DISEASE_Acne_Vulgaris @DISEASE_MESH:D000152 @@@acne@@@, ovarian volume, BMI had been clearly noticed in the study group.

citations.NLM: Seyam E, Al Gelany S, Abd Al Ghaney A, Mohamed MAA, Youseff AM, Ibrahim EM, Khalifa EM, Hefzy E. Evaluation of prolonged use of statins on the clinical and biochemical abnormalities and ovulation dysfunction in single young women with polycystic ovary syndrome. Gynecol Endocrinol. 2018 Jul;34(7):589-596. PMID: 29258367
